grammar.q: I ___ to be in New York by 5 PM.
There ___ a yellow sign over there.
You ___ pay with cash or card.
You can pay ___ a credit card.
He gave her $50 and told her to keep the ___

reading.q: Why does the man want to take the earlier train?
reading.a: He wants to avoid being late for his meeting.
options: He wants to avoid being late for his meeting.
He prefers to sleep on the train.
He wants to eat on the train.
He wants to meet a friend.

reading.q: What time does the express train arrive?
How much is second class?
Where does bus number 5 stop?
How do you use the ticket machine?
reading.a: Select destination → choose number of tickets → pay
options: Select destination → choose number of tickets → pay

reading.q: Why does the woman need help?
reading.a: She wants to go to Central Park.
options: She wants to go to Central Park.
She wants to find a hotel.

reading.q: Where can she buy a bus ticket?
How long is the ride to the airport?
How much is the ride to the airport?
Why does the passenger give $50?
reading.a: He wants the driver to keep the change.
options: He wants the driver to keep the change.
He wants to pay for two rides.
He is paying for a friend.

reading.q: Where is the Hilton Hotel?
What does the man want to know about?
What food is recommended?
Why can’t the man miss his 5 PM meeting?
options: He wants to eat dinner first.
He needs to meet a friend.

reading.q: What transportation does the woman take at the end?
Where does the taxi drop the man off?
What does the man say after arriving?
What does the woman ask before giving directions?
What does 'Here we are' mean?
What does the driver ask the man to provide?

mixed.q: You want to buy a bus ticket. What do you say?
mixed.a: Where can I buy a ticket?
options: Where can I buy a ticket?

mixed.q: Someone tells you: “Follow the yellow sign.” What should you do?
mixed.a: Walk in the direction of the yellow sign.
options: Walk in the direction of the yellow sign.

mixed.q: You want to pay for a taxi. What do you ask?
mixed.a: Can I pay with a credit card?
options: Can I pay with a credit card?

mixed.q: Which sentence matches the situation: You arrive at your hotel.
mixed.a: Thank you for the ride.

mixed.q: Which is polite when asking for help?
mixed.a: Excuse me, could you help me?
options: Excuse me, could you help me?

mixed.q: You want a seat next to the aisle. What do you say?
mixed.a: I’d like an aisle seat.

mixed.q: A machine asks you to choose your destination. What do you select?
mixed.a: the place you want to go
options: the place you want to go

mixed.q: Someone says: “Keep the change.” What does it mean?
mixed.a: You don’t need to give back the extra money.
options: You don’t need to give back the extra money.

mixed.q: You need to get to Central Park. What do you ask?
mixed.a: What’s the best way to go from here?
options: What’s the best way to go from here?

mixed.q: You arrive at the platform. What should you do?
mixed.a: Wait for your train.

mixed.q: You’re told: “Stay on until the last stop.” What should you do?
mixed.a: Do not get off early.

mixed.q: You want to find line 10. What do you follow?
mixed.a: the yellow sign

mixed.q: You need a taxi to the airport. What do you say?
mixed.a: I need to get to the airport.
options: I need to get to the airport.

mixed.q: You want to check the train time. What do you ask?
mixed.a: What time does the train arrive?
options: What time does the train arrive?

mixed.q: Which sentence matches this situation: You bought a ticket at the machine.
mixed.a: I just bought my ticket from the machine.
options: I just bought my ticket from the machine.
I need a seat by the window.

mixed.q: You need to know the cost. What do you ask?
mixed.a: How much is the ticket?

mixed.q: Someone says: “Have a great trip!” What do you reply?
mixed.a: Thanks!

mixed.q: You want to relax for a few days. Which sentence fits?
mixed.a: I have time to relax for a few days.
options: I have time to relax for a few days.
I want to buy a ticket.

mixed.q: You want a restaurant recommendation. What do you ask?
mixed.a: Do you have any restaurants to recommend?
options: Do you have any restaurants to recommend?

mixed.q: You’re told: “Here we are.” What does it mean?
mixed.a: We have arrived at the destination.
options: We have arrived at the destination.
